result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber M Newell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 6/15/16; alternate 7 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber M Newell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amber M Newell in court with Attorney Jess Martinez.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez states he is having trouble verifying community service. State moves to amend to county ordinance theft.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $330.50 - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 6/15/16, alternate 7 days jail if not paid.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 5/16/16
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Amber M Newell in court with attorney Jess Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to get the documents that she did her community service. Court grants the request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Amber M Newell did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant still needs to complete an additional 10 hours of community service to take advantage of the State's officer.   The Court grants the adjournment request but issues a capias but stays it til next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-23-2016 02:00 pm

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Amber M Newell did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Martinez is requesting adjournment so his client can complete some community service and some counseling. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Dated 1/28/15 filed by Attorney Martinez requesting Court excuse defendant from 1/29/15 hearing.
Plea hearing at 01-29-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Amber M Newell did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to undergo some community service and take some course that was just offered by the state. Court grants.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 12-04-2015 10:30 am

Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Amber M Newell did not appear.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting adjournment  as they made a counter offer to the DA assigned to the case. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/19/15

Defendant Amber M Newell in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel was just provided with Discovery and pre-trial offer and would like adjournment to speak with his client. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 10-19-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Amber M Newell in court.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not have counsel.  Defendant to go to the public defenders office today after 1:00 pm.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing at 09-24-2015 09:30 am
Defendant to have no contact with co defendants, victim/witness or Woodman's Food Market listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Amber M Newell in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
